revised_title: Dynamics of Vibrating Flames in Tubes
tldr: The author proposes a mechanism of flame vibration that depends on the instability of a reacting gas with respect to wave motion. They investigate the dynamical properties of a flame advancing down a tube and calculate the relative values of the intensities and frequencies of possible acoustic modes. The results show general agreement with observations and provide a method for experimental determination of the rate of growth of the amplitudes of the permissible modes of vibration.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric and Combustion Science
